Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw two different habitats, one on land and one in water, with recognizable features such as trees or grass for land and waves or fish for water.
The student can include representations of various living things for each habitat, such as a squirrel and oak tree in the forest, and a fish and lily pad in the pond.
The student can show some differences in living things between the habitats, illustrating basic understanding of habitat diversity (like placing birds in trees and ducks on water surfaces).
CANNOT: The student may occasionally confuse which animals are exclusive to one habitat, such as mistakenly placing a dolphin in the pond (reflects a mix-up between habitats).
The student might not fully illustrate or label all elements, such as forgetting to show the diversity of smaller living organisms in each habitat (e.g., insects or algae).
